Title.evidence: Six‐month data are presented from a randomized trial evaluating whether IBBR with ADM provides higher health‐related quality of life (HRQoL) and patient‐reported cosmetic outcomes compared with conventional IBBR without ADM.

Trial_Design.evidence: In this multicentre open‐label RCT, women with breast cancer planned for mastectomy with immediate IBBR in four centres in Sweden and one in the UK were allocated randomly (1 : 1) to IBBR with or without ADM.

Participants.evidence: women with breast cancer planned for mastectomy with immediate IBBR in four centres in Sweden and one in the UK

Intervention.evidence: allocated randomly (1 : 1) to IBBR with or without ADM

Objective.evidence: evaluating whether IBBR with ADM provides higher health‐related quality of life (HRQoL) and patient‐reported cosmetic outcomes compared with conventional IBBR without ADM.

Method_Outcome.evidence: HRQoL, a secondary endpoint, was measured as patient‐reported outcome measures (PROMs) using three validated instruments (EORTC‐QLQC30, QLQ‐BR23, QLQ‐BRR26) at baseline and 6 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: allocated randomly (1 : 1) to IBBR with or without ADM

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between 24 April 2014 and 10 May 2017, 135 women were enrolled

Number_Analysed.evidence: 64 with and 65 without ADM were included in the final analysis

Result_Outcome.evidence: cosmetic outcome (8·66, 95 per cent c.i. 0·46 to 16·86; P = 0·041) and problems finding a well‐fitting bra (−13·21, −25·54 to −0·89; P = 0·038)
